saf.core.ui

Interface IWindowCustomizer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WindowCustomizer

    public interface IWindowCustomizer
    Inteface for customizing the initial application window in a SAF application.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.4 $ $Date: 2006/06/01 16:29:06 $
    Author:
    Nick Collier

    • Method Detail

      • getTitle

        java.lang.String getTitle()
        Gets the title of the initial application window. This may be null or an empty String if no title has been set yet.
        Returns:
        the title of the initial application window. This may be null or an empty String if no title has been set yet.

      • setTitle

        void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets the title of the initial application window.
        Parameters:
        title - the window title

      • getInitialBounds

        java.awt.Rectangle getInitialBounds()
        Gets the initial bounds of the main application window. This may be null or 0 size bounds if the initial bounds have not been set yet.
        Returns:
        the initial bounds of the main application window. This may be null or 0 size bounds if the initial bounds have not been set yet.

      • getExtendedState

        int getExtendedState()
        Gets the extended state of the main application window.
        Returns:
        the extended state of the main application window.
        See Also:
        Frame.setExtendedState(int)

      • setInitialBounds

        void setInitialBounds(int width,
                    int height)
        Sets the intial size of the application window to the specified width and height. The application location will be centered on the screen.
        Parameters:
        width - the initial width
        height - the initial height

      • setInitialBounds

        void setInitialBounds(int x,
                    int y,
                    int width,
                    int height)
        Sets the intial bounds of the application window to the specified width, height, and location.
        Parameters:
        x - the x screen coordinate
        y - the y screen coordinate
        width - the initial width
        height - the initial height

      • setExtendedState

        Sets the extended state of the main application window.
        Parameters:
        state - the state
        See Also:

      • useStoredFrameBounds

        void useStoredFrameBounds(int defWidth,
                        int defHeight)
        Tells SAF to use the previously stored bounds for this application, or if no stored bounds are found, use the default values and center the application on the screen.
        Parameters:
        defWidth - the default width
        defHeight - the default height

      • useSavedLayout

        void useSavedLayout()
        Tells SAF to use the saved layout (dockable locations and fill percentages) in place of those defined in the plugin. If nothing has been saved, the plugin values are used by default. By default the layout data will be saved in directory named after the plugin id in the user's home directory. This directory will be hidden, that is, prefixed with a ".". So for example, assuming the application plugin id is "saf.demo.app", then the layout data will be saved in the user's home directory in the ".saf.demo.app" directory.

      • useSavedLayout

        void useSavedLayout(java.lang.String path)
        Tells SAF to use the saved layout (dockable locations and fill percentages) in place of those defined in the plugin. If nothing has been saved, the plugin values are used by default. The layouts will be saved to the specified path. The layout data will be saved to the specified directory.
        Parameters:
        path - the directory to save the layout(s) to

      • getWindowsMenuLabel

        java.lang.String getWindowsMenuLabel()
        Gets the window's menu label. The windows menu is the menu that contains all of the currently open views.
        Returns:
        the the window's menu label

      • setWindowMenuLabel

        void setWindowMenuLabel(java.lang.String label)
        Sets the window's menu label. The windows menu is the menu that contains all of the currently open views.
        Parameters:
        label - the new window's menu label
